did.unittitle: Bernard Ross papers and office files

bioghist.p: Bernard Ross (b. 1916) was a professor of social work and the first dean (1970-1978) of Bryn Mawr's School of Social Work and Social Research. Before coming to Bryn Mawr in 1958, Ross worked with the National Housing Agency and with the President's Committee on Fair Employment Practice, and taught at University of Pittsburgh and Michigan State University.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of Bernard Ross. Materials include office files from the Bryn Mawr School of Social Work; printed materials, articles, and research notes on housing, civil rights, race and community relations, and fair employment; Ross's master's thesis on leadership in social education; student papers; notes and drafts for articles; printed materials on veteran's benefits; and ephemera and photographs.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
